intro: Cordyline forbesii, commonly known as the New Zealand cabbage tree, is a striking plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its tall, unbranched trunk and large, sword-shaped leaves. The plant can grow up to 10 meters in height, with a fibrous, hollow stem that resembles a bamboo. Its leaves are typically a deep green, and it produces small, fragrant white flowers in clusters at the top of the stem. Cordyline forbesii is well adapted to coastal and subalpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sunlight.
